title: Cement consumption volume in India 2008 to 2019
summary: This is a bar chart representing Fiscal Annually in the x axis and Consumption in million metric tons in the y axis.
Fiscal Annually FY 2019 has the highest Consumption in million metric tons and FY 2011 has the lowest Consumption in million metric tons.
Fiscal Annually FY 2011 has 1.98 times less Consumption in million metric tons than Fiscal Annually FY 2019 which is the highest.
min_summary: This bar chart has 11 columns on the x axis representing Fiscal Annually, and Consumption in million metric tons in each Fiscal Annually on the y axis.
Fiscal Annually FY 2019 has the highest Consumption in million metric tons and FY 2011 has the lowest Consumption in million metric tons.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Fiscal Annually in the x axis and Consumption in million metric tons in the y axis.

max_summary: This bar chart has 11 columns on the x axis representing Fiscal Annually, and Consumption in million metric tons in each Fiscal Annually on the y axis.
The Consumption in million metric tons is highest at Fiscal Annually FY 2019 and lowest at Fiscal Annually FY 2011.
Fiscal Annually  has the second highest value for Consumption in million metric tons.
The difference of Consumption in million metric tons between the highest and lowest Fiscal Annually is 162.0.
Consumption in million metric tons at Fiscal Annually FY 2019 is 328.0 , second place is  at 328.0, and thirdly is FY 2016 at 269.0.
Fiscal Annually FY 2018, and FY 2016 share the same value 269.0.
The average Consumption in million metric tons in all 11 Fiscal Annuallys is 242.18.
The Consumption in million metric tons is 2664.0 if we add up values of all Fiscal Annuallys.
